content: The code above imports the pandas library and reads in the "yelp\_academic\_dataset\_business.json" file, which contains information about businesses from Yelp's database. The file is read in using the pandas function "pd.read\_json()" and is stored in a variable called "df\_business". The "lines=True" parameter is used to specify that the file is in json format with each line representing a separate entry. The "df\_business.info()" function is then used to display information about the dataframe, including the number of entries, the data types of each column, and the number of non-null values for each column.
